greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of phi(-q)chi(-q)psi(q^3) in powers of q where phi(),chi(),psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) := Prod_{k>=1} (1-(-q)^k) (see A121373), phi(q) := theta_3(q) := Sum_{k=-oo..oo} q^(k^2) (A000122), psi(q) := Sum_{k=0..oo} q^(k*(k+1)/2) (A010054), chi(q) := Prod_{k>=0} (1+q^(2k+1)) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-1/3)*eta(q)^3*eta(q^6)^2/(eta(q^2)^2*eta(q^3)) in powers of q.
a(n)=b(3n+1) where b(n) is multiplicative and b(2^e) = -3(1+(-1)^e)/2 if e>0, b(3^e) = 0^e, b(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1 (mod 6), b(p^e) = (1+(-1)^e)/2 if p == 5 (mod 6).
mathematica: A122861[n_] := SeriesCoefficient[(QPochhammer[q]^3*QPochhammer[q^6]^2)/(QPochhammer[q^2]^2 *QPochhammer[q^3]), {q, 0, n}]; Table[A122861[n], {n, 0, 50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 05 2017 *)
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Sep 15 2006
